definition: to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

sentences.english: B You know, she is moody sometimes. I wouldn’t worry about it.
sentences.chinese: 你知道她有时候喜怒无常，我是不会为此而担心的。

sentences.english: I'm boring, I'm moody, you can't take me any place.
sentences.chinese: 我很无趣，喜怒无常，你甩不掉我。

sentences.english: She is a temperamental person and likes to make tasteless jokes.
sentences.chinese: 她是个喜怒无常的人，而且喜欢开粗俗的玩笑。

sentences.english: B: You know, she is moody sometimes. I wouldn’t worry about it.
sentences.chinese: 你知道她有时候喜怒无常，我是不会为此而担心的。

sentences.english: But some men are more moody and emotional than women.
sentences.chinese: 但是有的男人比女人更加喜怒无常，情绪波动大。

sentences.english: The moodiness of adolescents makes it all the more tricky, Grady says.
sentences.chinese: 青少年的喜怒无常使这种情况更加令人琢磨不透。

sentences.english: Markets have moods and biases that need to be counterbalanced.
sentences.chinese: 市场喜怒无常且有成见和偏爱，需要予以制衡。

sentences.english: Inevitability and temperament are two hallmarks of Gates the innovator.
sentences.chinese: 势不可当和喜怒无常是革新者盖茨的两大标志。

sentences.english: Her moodiness and need for drama are also part of her allure.
sentences.chinese: 而喜怒无常以及追求刺激也是她的魅力所在。

sentences.english: More moody colors account for about 17 percent of cars.
sentences.chinese: 偏喜怒无常个性的颜色占全部车数的17%。

sentences.english: He has learnt to live with her moodiness.
sentences.chinese: 他学会了忍受她的喜怒无常。

sentences.english: It is difficult to predict his reaction because he is so moody/ temperamental.
sentences.chinese: 他如此喜怒无常，所以很难预知其反应如何。

sentences.english: This also at times reflects their moody nature.
sentences.chinese: 这也就反映了其喜怒无常的天性。

sentences.english: It is also more likely to make them moody.
sentences.chinese: 睡眠不足也更可能使他们喜怒无常。

definition: to vent one's anger on an innocent party (idiom)
